If yes, please provide details., SDG Focus, Priorities Areas of Development, State the (green) problem you are solving and how you first identified it, Traction: Your monthly sales or monthly active users/or clients, Team growth plans: What are your current plans to grow the business?, Your solution / value proposition: What is the Company offering?, Impact and key impact indicators: How do you measure success beyond financial revenues? What kind of impact have you already had?, Investment or Funding Raised, Elaborate on your priority areas of development (max 250 words), Link to 2 min pitch video (Please use loom.com or another tool to record a short 2 min introduction video about your team and your company)Female, REGION - MENA, 25-29, Lebanon, 96176653852, Hi, i am a Lebanese women who worked very hard to achieve all her dreams.
I work in an insurance company and with the help of a friend we created a Lebanese organic skincare product that  aim to help, support and empower women's in need, I am working hard to make jouri a well recognized skincare Lebanese brand and i need help from programs to achieve my dream of empowering women's, educating the community on the importance of organic products and promoting suitable beauty eco friendly products , Lebanon, https://www.instagram.com/jouri.co/, Health Care; General / Other, 3.2. Have a functioning (high-fidelity) prototype with early users / early adopters) , 3, 0, Toufic Kassem - Founder- Chemical engineer
Yasmine Samhoun - co founder- Managing director- masters n risk management
Nancy daoud- employee, Jouri Cosmetics, a Lebanese brand, brings you the finest natural and organic skincare and beauty products.

Our products are crafted with carefully selected natural and organic ingredients, ensuring the highest quality for your skin. Say goodbye to harsh chemicals and embrace the rejuvenating benefits of nature.

We believe in providing effective skincare solutions while prioritizing your well-being. Our products offer the most effective results without compromising your skin's health.


Jouri Cosmetics is more than just a brand; it's a symbol of empowerment. We support and encourage Lebanese women to pursue their dreams, work hard, and never give up. Together, we can achieve greatness! 

We empower you to make healthier choices for your skin. With Jouri Cosmetics, you can look and feel beautiful while prioritizing your skin's health and overall well-being.

Join Jouri Cosmetics journey today and experience the beauty of nature in every product. Let us be your partner in achieving radiant and healthy skin, naturally.
, registered  as a Lebanese entity, 6/18/2021, Self-employed/Entrepreneur, no, SDG GOAL 3: Good Health and Well-being, Revenues, Financial Management & Sustainability, Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemicals skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes. 
Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing the exposure to harmful chemicals for consumers. 
, we offer our products on ishtari platform, shop in gemmayze and through direct sales on instagram .
Monthly sales is almost 500 USD, Raising awareness
Jouri aims to improve human‚Äôs lives by offering safe and natural skincare products. Reducing  the risk of skin irritation, allergies, and long-term health effects associated with chemicals skincare products.
Jouri  encourage women to prioritize their self-care routines. This commitment to self-care promotes not only physical health but also boosts self-confidence, helping women feel their best and embrace their natural beauty.
Furthermore,  Jouri believes in supporting women's. Through their products, they strive to create a positive impact on women's lives by fostering a sense of self-worth and self-acceptance. 
By following this theory of change, Jouri Cosmetics seeks to improve women's lives by providing safe and natural skincare products, promoting self-care and empowerment, raising awareness, supporting social causes, and advocating for positive change in the beauty industry.
, Jouri goes beyond providing natural and organic products. It takes an active role in promoting the well-being of its consumers, minimizing its environmental impact, supporting social causes, and promoting transparency, Jouri contribute to a more sustainable and socially conscious beauty industry, allowing consumers to care for their skin while also caring for the planet and the communities around them.
Furthermore, Jouri empower consumers to make informed choices and understand the benefits of using organic skincare products not only for themselves but also for the environment.
Jouri is aiming to collaborate with local farmers, artisans, or cooperatives, promoting fair trade and creating economic opportunities in underprivileged regions of Lebanon and we are planning to allocate a portion of our profits to charitable organizations that focus on environmental conservation, community development, or initiatives related to health and wellness.
, 
, none, Social outcomes:
1.	Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemicals skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes. 
2.	Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing the exposure to harmful chemicals for consumers. 
3.	Invest in consumer education initiatives to raise awareness about the benefits of organic and natural skincare. This can include providing information about ingredients, product usage..
We are working on reaching as much as we can and as planned by 3 years we will be able to reach 70-80% of the Lebanese population and working also in reaching worldwide 
, NA"

as a string and i want to update a table with these related headings in another table called All_Applications:
"Name", "Email", "Team Name", "Workspace Name", "What is your motivation to join the program?", "Gender", "Geographic Location", "Age", "Nationality", "Phone number", "Social Media Links", "Describe your company in 120 characters", "Sectors", "Entreprise stage pre-funding", "Current Team Size", "Team Roles and Background", "Founding Date (31/12/2022) MM/DD/YYYY", "Registration Status of The Company", "Type of Company", "Registration country", "Website", "Team growth plans: What are your current plans to grow the business?", "State the (green) problem you are solving and how you first identified it", "Your solution / value proposition: What is the Company offering?", "Traction: Your monthly sales or monthly active users/or clients", "SDG Focus", "Impact and key impact indicators: How do you measure success beyond financial revenues? What kind of impact have you already had?", "Investment or Funding Raised", "Priorities Areas of Development", "Elaborate on your priority areas of development (max 250 words)", "Link to 2 min pitch video (Please use loom.com or another tool to record a short 2 min introduction video about your team and your company)", "Have you participated in any other accelerator or mentorship programs before? If yes, please provide details."

Can you help me write this script?

Certainly! The task you're describing involves parsing a long string of data and then updating an Airtable table with the parsed data. 

Here's a step-by-step breakdown of what we'll do:

1. Split the input string into individual data points.
2. Map the data points to the corresponding fields in the Airtable table.
3. Use the Airtable API to update the table with the parsed data.

For the sake of this example, I'll provide a script that accomplishes the first two steps. The third step would require you to use the Airtable API, which is a bit more involved and would require your API key and base ID.

Here's the script for the first two steps:

```javascript
// Sample input string
let inputString = "ü§∏üèΩ Profile and Motivation, ..."; // truncated for brevity

// Split the input string into individual data points
let dataPoints = inputString.split(", ");

// Define the mapping between the data points and the Airtable fields
let fieldMapping = {
    "Name": null, // This seems to be missing from the input string
    "Email": null, // This seems to be missing from the input string
    "Team Name": null, // This seems to be missing from the input string
    "Workspace Name": null, // This seems to be missing from the input string
    "What is your motivation to join the program?": dataPoints[25],
    "Gender": dataPoints[22],
    "Geographic Location": dataPoints[23],
    "Age": dataPoints[24],
    "Nationality": dataPoints[26],
    "Phone number": dataPoints[27],
    "Social Media Links": dataPoints[28],
    "Describe your company in 120 characters": dataPoints[32],
    "Sectors": dataPoints[29],
    "Entreprise stage pre-funding": dataPoints[30],
    "Current Team Size": dataPoints[31],
    "Team Roles and Background": dataPoints[33],
    "Founding Date (31/12/2022) MM/DD/YYYY": dataPoints[35],
    "Registration Status of The Company": dataPoints[34],
    "Type of Company": dataPoints[36],
    "Registration country": dataPoints[26],
    "Website": dataPoints[28],
    "Team growth plans: What are your current plans to grow the business?": dataPoints[38],
    "State the (green) problem you are solving and how you first identified it": dataPoints[37],
    "Your solution / value proposition: What is the Company offering?": dataPoints[39],
    "Traction: Your monthly sales or monthly active users/or clients": dataPoints[40],
    "SDG Focus": dataPoints[41],
    "Impact and key impact indicators: How do you measure success beyond financial revenues? What kind of impact have you already had?": dataPoints[42],
    "Investment or Funding Raised": dataPoints[43],
    "Priorities Areas of Development": dataPoints[44],
    "Elaborate on your priority areas of development (max 250 words)": dataPoints[45],
    "Link to 2 min pitch video (Please use loom.com or another tool to record a short 2 min introduction video about your team and your company)": dataPoints[46],
    "Have you participated in any other accelerator or mentorship programs before? If yes, please provide details.": dataPoints[47]
};

console.log(fieldMapping);
```

This script will parse the input string and map the data points to the corresponding fields in the Airtable table. The next step would be to use the Airtable API to update the table with the parsed data.

Note: The provided input string seems to be missing some data points (e.g., "Name", "Email", "Team Name", "Workspace Name"). You'll need to adjust the script accordingly if you have additional data or if the order of the data points changes.
